subject: Way/Why
msgSnippet: I sought out this group because I was having a hard time distinguishing Awe-Ah-Ox. It s gratifying to see that I m not the only one with that problem. (I m
messageBody:
I sought out this group because I was having a hard time distinguishing Awe-Ah-Ox. It's gratifying to see that I'm not the only one with that problem. (I'm California-born and Seattle-raised, so no wonder).

I have a similar problem distinguishing Why from Way. Is this also characteristic of the western USA? Is the letter combination "wh" always written with Why? Are there any other cases that you would use it? For me, "wine" and "whine" or "weather" and "whether" are homophones.

Since I'm learning Quickscript for personal use, it doesn't make much difference, I was just curious.

Lauren
